revised_title: A Description of the Oxyoides Plant and its Sensitivity to Touch
tldr: The author describes a new family of plants called Oxyoides, which are similar to Tamarind leaves in appearance and have a high sensitivity to touch. The Oxyoides plant grows in the Island of Java and possibly other islands in the region. The leaves close when touched and open again gradually, and they also respond to sunlight and moisture in their environment.
